intro: Pterolepis alpestris, commonly known as the alpine pterolepis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, triangular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Pterolepis alpestris is adapted to cold climates and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
